intro: Limnanthes alba subsp. parishii, commonly known as the white marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wet meadows and marshy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its subspecies status highlights subtle differences in morphology compared to the broader species. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
